President Trump falsely claimed that NAT: defense spending went down "very substantially" prior to his first NATO meeting in May 2017.
In reality: NATO Europe and Canada increased their defense spending by 1.83 percent in 2015 and 3.14 percent in 2016, before Trump attended his first meeting.
From 2014 to 2016: NATO Europe and Canada increased their defense spending by $14 billion, or 5 percent, in constant 2010 U.S. dollars.
Since Trump: s meeting, NATO countries have further increased their defense spending by $26 billion, or 9 percent, from 2016 to 2018.
